format_1_state_log.event_description: SNF Physical Therapy and Attending Physician sign off on home discharge with 2x/week RN and 3x/week PT orders for fall prevention and gait training.
Preferred Home Health Agency (HHA) fails to acknowledge the referral; PN discovers the sole Intake Coordinator is out on unscheduled PTO with no coverage plan.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: The HHA's single-point-of-failure administrative structure prevents the referral from being entered into the scheduling system.

format_1_state_log.event_description: PN facilitates communication between the SNF Social Worker and the HHA's Clinical Director to bypass the intake desk and secure a Start-of-Care (SOC) nurse.
format_1_state_log.ai_assumed_bottleneck: N/A - PN successfully re-routed the administrative workflow

format_2_triples.situation: The HHA Intake Coordinator is unavailable, leaving the 86yo dementia patient's referral in an unread digital queue while the SNF prepares for a Friday discharge.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Contacted the HHA Clinical Director directly to verify nurse availability for a Saturday 'Start of Care' visit.
format_2_triples.tactical_field_intent: Bypass administrative gatekeeping to lock in a weekend admission slot before the SNF closes the file.

format_2_triples.situation: Patient's daughter expresses concern that the HHA won't show up until Monday, leaving her father without supervision for 72 hours.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Provided the daughter with a physical transition card containing the HHA Clinical Director's direct line and the confirmed Saturday visit window.
format_2_triples.tactical_field_intent: Hard-wire the family's expectation of service to prevent them from seeking a last-minute SNF extension or ER return.

format_2_triples.situation: The SNF Social Worker is unaware that the HHA intake desk is unstaffed, which could lead to a 'silent' discharge delay.
format_2_triples.action_taken: Briefed the SW on the HHA's internal staffing gap and shared the alternative contact path used to confirm the SOC.
format_2_triples.tactical_field_intent: Maintain the facility relationship by providing 'ground-truth' intelligence they lack, ensuring the PN remains the preferred transition partner.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Wait for the HHA Intake Coordinator to return to the office on Monday morning to process the referral and schedule the initial home health assessment.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This follows the standard institutional workflow and avoids disrupting the HHA's internal administrative processes, though it risks a 3-day gap in care.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Coordinate a direct conversation between the HHA Clinical Director and the family to confirm a weekend Start-of-Care nurse is assigned despite the intake coordinator's absence.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This ensures clinical continuity for a high-risk dementia patient by navigating around a specific administrative bottleneck within the HHA's office.

format_3_rl_scenario.description: Contact the patient's Managed Medicare insurance provider to request an emergency override for the home health authorization due to the HHA's internal staffing shortage.
format_3_rl_scenario.rationale: This oversteps the PN role by performing a task (insurance authorization management) that is strictly the responsibility of the HHA's billing department or the facility Social Worker.

narrative_summary: An 86-year-old male with dementia and a high fall risk was prepared for transition from a skilled nursing facility to home health care. The transition was threatened when the primary HHA's intake coordinator went on leave, stalling the admission process and risking a dangerous weekend gap in services. The Patient Navigator intervened by bypassing the administrative bottleneck, coordinating directly with the HHA's clinical leadership to ensure a Saturday nurse visit. This proactive coordination secured the home health conversion and ensured the patient had professional oversight immediately following his return home.
